europeana:record.dc:title: Troglodytes of a muddy bottom: the hydroid fauna of holes in the seabed
Zoologische Verhandelingen
europeana:record.dc:creator: Watson J.E.
europeana:record.dc:subject: Porifera, Coelenterata, Echinodermata, Brachyopoda
Hydroids; polychaete tubes; Port Phillip Bay; Australia.
europeana:record.dc:description: During ecological surveys in Port Phillip Bay Victoria, Australia, colonies of minute leptothecate hydroids were found living in tubes in a muddy seabed, the tubes probably being those of polychaete worms. Three species are recorded: two are new species and the third, provisionally assigned to Rathkea octopunctata, is a new record for Australia.
europeana:record.dcterms:isPartOf: Troglodytes of a muddy bottom: the hydroid fauna of holes in the seabed (URN:ISSN:0024-1652) (Volume 323) (Issue 20)
